item.title: Critical Erlang/OTP SSH Flaw Exposes Many Devices to Remote Hacking
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Servers exposed to complete takeover due to CVE-2025-32433, an unauthenticated remote code execution flaw in Erlang/OTP SSH.

The post Critical Erlang/OTP SSH Flaw Exposes Many Devices to Remote Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of April 14, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of April 14, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Why ‘One Community’ Resonates in Cybersecurity
item.dc:creator: Marc Solomon
item.description:
Our collective voices and one community will provide the intelligence we need to safeguard our businesses in today’s modern digital environment.

The post Why ‘One Community’ Resonates in Cybersecurity appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA Issues Guidance After Oracle Cloud Hack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
CISA is making recommendations for organizations and users in light of the recent Oracle legacy cloud environment hack.

The post CISA Issues Guidance After Oracle Cloud Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese APT Mustang Panda Updates, Expands Arsenal
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Mustang Panda has used new and updated malicious tools in a recent attack.

The post Chinese APT Mustang Panda Updates, Expands Arsenal appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SonicWall Flags Old Vulnerability as Actively Exploited
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
A SonicWall SMA 100 series vulnerability patched in 2021, which went unnoticed at the time of patching, is being exploited in the wild.

The post SonicWall Flags Old Vulnerability as Actively Exploited appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: MITRE Hackers’ Backdoor Has Targeted Windows for Years
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Windows versions of the BrickStorm backdoor that the Chinese APT used in the MITRE hack last year have been active for years.

The post MITRE Hackers’ Backdoor Has Targeted Windows for Years appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Krebs Exits SentinelOne After Security Clearance Pulled
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Chris Krebs has resigned from SentinelOne after security clearance withdrawn and an order to review CISA’s conduct under his leadership.

The post Krebs Exits SentinelOne After Security Clearance Pulled appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Apple Quashes Two Zero-Days With iOS, MacOS Patches
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The vulnerabilities are described as code execution and mitigation bypass issues that affect Apple’s iOS, iPadOS and macOS platforms.

The post Apple Quashes Two Zero-Days With iOS, MacOS Patches appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: MITRE CVE Program Gets Last-Hour Funding Reprieve
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The US government's cybersecurity agency CISA has “executed the option period on the contract” to keep the vulnerability catalog operational.

The post MITRE CVE Program Gets Last-Hour Funding Reprieve appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Many Mobile Apps Fail Basic Security—Posing Serious Risks to Enterprises
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Top-ranked mobile apps found using hardcoded keys and exposed cloud buckets.

The post Many Mobile Apps Fail Basic Security—Posing Serious Risks to Enterprises appeared first on SecurityWeek.
